plausible_answers.text: if there has been substantial heart damage and resultant left ventricular failure

qas.question: Cardiac rehabilitation is not an option under what circumstances?

plausible_answers.text: driving, flying, sport participation, stress management, and sexual intercourse

qas.question: Cardiac rehabilitation often recommends ceasing what activities?
What should start immediately upon registering at the hospital?
When are other medical conditions address?

context: <b2_0>Cardiac rehabilitation<b2_0/> benefits many who have experienced myocardial infarction, even <b0_0>if there has been substantial heart damage and resultant left ventricular failure<b0_0/>; ideally other medical conditions that could interfere with participation should be managed optimally. It should start <b3_0>soon after discharge from hospital<b3_0/>. The program may include lifestyle advice, exercise, social support, as well as recommendations about <b1_0>driving, flying, sport participation, stress management, and sexual intercourse<b1_0/>.
